revised_title: Morphological Analysis of Neurons in the Turtle Retina
tldr: The author studied the morphology of bipolar, amacrine, and ganglion cells in the turtle retina using the Golgi method. They identified nine types of bipolar cells, 27 types of amacrine cells, and 21 types of ganglion cells based on their dendritic branching patterns, morphology, dendritic tree sizes, and stratification in the inner plexiform layer. The orientation of these cells relative to the linear visual streak is discussed, and the findings are compared with other vertebrate retinas.
